calculator.title: Investment Calculator
calculator.subtitle: Calculate your investment returns with compound interest

recommendations.title: Recommendation
recommendations.subtitle: Based on your inputs, we recommend a tailored investment portfolio. Below are detailed suggestions for a moderate risk profile, designed for long-term growth.

riskAssessment.label: Risk Assessment
riskAssessment.title: Moderate Risk
riskAssessment.description: This portfolio balances potential returns with risk mitigation, suitable for long-term growth with some tolerance for market fluctuations.

strategicAdvice.label: Strategic Advice
strategicAdvice.title: Diversification & Rebalancing
strategicAdvice.description: Diversify across different asset classes to reduce risk. We suggest reviewing your portfolio annually or semi-annually to rebalance it back to your target allocation.

historicalExamples.label: Historical Examples
historicalExamples.title: Past Performance Analysis
historicalExamples.description: Historically, a portfolio with this allocation has shown resilience during market downturns while capturing growth in bull markets. The average annual return has been in the 6-8% range.

conservative.title: Conservative Portfolio
conservative.description: Low risk, steady returns. Ideal for capital preservation.

moderate.title: Moderate Portfolio
moderate.description: Balanced risk and return. Good for long-term growth.

aggressive.title: Aggressive Portfolio
aggressive.description: Higher risk, higher potential returns. For growth-focused investors.

explanations.title: Calculation Explained - Formulas & Explanations
explanations.subtitle: Understanding the mathematics behind compound interest and how each input field affects your investment growth.

initialCapital.title: Initial Capital
initialCapital.description: The starting amount you invest. This grows through compound interest over time.

monthlyAddition.title: Monthly Addition
monthlyAddition.description: Regular monthly contributions that accelerate growth through dollar-cost averaging.

annualRate.title: Annual Rate
annualRate.description: Expected yearly return percentage. Historical stock market average is ~7-10%.

termYears.title: Term (Years)
termYears.description: Investment duration. Longer periods amplify compound interest effects exponentially.

compoundingFrequency.title: Compounding Frequency
compoundingFrequency.description: How often interest is calculated and added. More frequent = slightly higher returns.

targetAmount.title: Target Amount
targetAmount.description: Your financial goal. The calculator can solve for any missing variable.

totalInvested.title: Total Invested
totalInvested.description: Initial capital + all monthly additions. This is your actual out-of-pocket investment.

interestEarned.title: Interest Earned
interestEarned.description: Money generated purely from compound growth. This is your investment's 'free money'.

finalValue.title: Final Value
finalValue.description: Total portfolio value: invested amount + compound interest earned over time.

time.title: Time is Your Greatest Asset
time.description: Starting early, even with smaller amounts, often beats larger investments made later due to exponential growth.

consistency.title: Consistency Matters
consistency.description: Regular monthly additions leverage dollar-cost averaging and significantly boost long-term returns.

rateImpact.title: Rate Impact
rateImpact.description: Small differences in annual return rates (e.g., 6% vs 8%) create massive differences over decades.

compoundingFrequency.title: Compounding Frequency
compoundingFrequency.description: While daily compounding beats annual, the difference is smaller than most people expect.

compoundInterest.title: Compound Interest Formula
compoundInterest.description: The foundation of investment growth is compound interest, where your earnings generate their own earnings over time.

monthlyContributions.title: Monthly Contributions Impact
monthlyContributions.description: Regular monthly contributions significantly boost your investment growth through dollar-cost averaging and consistent compounding.

timeValue.title: Time Value of Money
timeValue.description: The earlier you start investing, the more time your money has to grow. Even small amounts can become substantial over long periods.
